remarks: If a word represents a walk in (in a graph) and there are edges between the last vertex of the word and another vertex and between this other vertex and the first vertex of the word, then the concatenation of the word representing the walk with this other vertex represents a closed walk.  (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 3-Oct-2018.)
statement: wwlkext2clwwlk $p |- ( ( W e. ( ( V WWalksN E ) ` N ) /\ Z e. V /\ N e. NN0 ) -> ( ( { ( lastS ` W ) , Z } e. ran E /\ { Z , ( W ` 0 ) } e. ran E ) -> ( W concat <" Z "> ) e. ( ( V ClWWalksN E ) ` ( N + 2 ) ) ) ) $.
